name: What Breed of Dog Did They Have? Multiple Choice Quiz | Animals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Sigmund Freud was assisted in his psychotherapy sessions by Jo-Fi, who was a...
questions.explanation:
Chow.

	Freud thought that Jo-Fi would move closer to patients as they became less stressed.

questions.text: Prime Minister of England Winston Churchill owned which breed of dog?
questions.explanation:
Miniature Poodle.

	Churchill was known as an animal lover, and had a poodle named Rufus during the Second World War. He also owned cats, and is said to have cared for all the animals on his estate, including the swans and pigs.

questions.text: President Ronald Reagan was bitten in the behind by Lucky, a...
questions.explanation:
Bouvier des Flandres.

	After several such incidents, Lucky was banished to the family ranch.

questions.text: In order to promote his 'tough guy' image, boxer Mike Tyson bought a ...
questions.explanation:
Bullmastiff.

	However, he neglected the dog, and the breeder, Mimi Einstein of Allstar Kennels, a tiny woman, drove to his house and demanded the dog back!

questions.text: President John F. Kennedy's favorite dog was Charlie, a ...
questions.explanation:
Welsh Terrier.

	He used to swim with the President- an unusual feat for a terrier!

questions.text: The artist Pablo Picasso owned a dog named Kabul whom Picasso claimed influenced his painting style. Kabul was an...
questions.explanation:
Afghan Hound.

	Picasso claimed that he would see Kabul in his mind while painting portraits, thus encouraging him to paint people with longer noses and finer, fluffier hair.

questions.text: Napoleon Bonaparte hated dogs, so he never owned one. He continued to hate them even after his life was saved by a...
questions.explanation:
Newfoundland.

	Napoleon slipped and fell from a boat and the Newfie saved him from drowning.

questions.text: One of the few living things famous scientist Isaac Newton cared for was his dog Diamond, a ...
questions.explanation:
Pomeranian.

	Newton didn't get along well with people, but he loved his dog. In one famous incident, Diamond tipped over a candle that burned up several years of Newton's work on gravity- but he just commented that she couldn't know what damage she had done.

questions.text: James Herriot, the veterinarian and author, was especially fond of his dog Bodie, a ...
questions.explanation:
Border Terrier.

	Herriot owned many dogs, but liked Bodie best.

questions.text: E.B. White, author of many books such as Charlotte's Web, had a love-hate relationship with his dog Fred, a ...
questions.explanation:
Dachshund.

	He once wrote that he'd rather train zebras to balance clubs on their noses than attempt to teach a Dachshund to do anything.
